string: ACT I
SCENE I. A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.
Enter DUKE SOLINUS, AEGEON, Gaoler, Officers, and other Attendants
AEGEON
speaker: AEGEON

string: Proceed, Solinus, to procure my fall
speaker: AEGEON

string: And by the doom of death end woes and all.
speaker: AEGEON

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Merchant of Syracuse, plead no more;
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: I am not partial to infringe our laws:
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: The enmity and discord which of late
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Sprung from the rancorous outrage of your duke
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: To merchants, our well-dealing countrymen,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Who wanting guilders to redeem their lives
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Have seal'd his rigorous statutes with their bloods,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Excludes all pity from our threatening looks.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: For, since the mortal and intestine jars
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: 'Twixt thy seditious countrymen and us,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: It hath in solemn synods been decreed
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Both by the Syracusians and ourselves,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: To admit no traffic to our adverse towns Nay, more,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: If any born at Ephesus be seen
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: At any Syracusian marts and fairs;
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Again: if any Syracusian born
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Come to the bay of Ephesus, he dies,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: His goods confiscate to the duke's dispose,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Unless a thousand marks be levied,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: To quit the penalty and to ransom him.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Thy substance, valued at the highest rate,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Cannot amount unto a hundred marks;
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Therefore by law thou art condemned to die.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: AEGEON
speaker: AEGEON

string: Yet this my comfort: when your words are done,
speaker: AEGEON

string: My woes end likewise with the evening sun.
speaker: AEGEON

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Well, Syracusian, say in brief the cause
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Why thou departed'st from thy native home
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: And for what cause thou camest to Ephesus.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: AEGEON
speaker: AEGEON

string: A heavier task could not have been imposed
speaker: AEGEON

string: Than I to speak my griefs unspeakable:
speaker: AEGEON

string: Yet, that the world may witness that my end
speaker: AEGEON

string: Was wrought by nature, not by vile offence,
speaker: AEGEON

string: I'll utter what my sorrows give me leave.
speaker: AEGEON

string: In Syracusa was I born, and wed
speaker: AEGEON

string: Unto a woman, happy but for me,
speaker: AEGEON

string: And by me, had not our hap been bad.
speaker: AEGEON

string: With her I lived in joy; our wealth increased
speaker: AEGEON

string: By prosperous voyages I often made
speaker: AEGEON

string: To Epidamnum; till my factor's death
speaker: AEGEON

string: And the great care of goods at random left
speaker: AEGEON

string: Drew me from kind embracements of my spouse:
speaker: AEGEON

string: From whom my absence was not six months old
speaker: AEGEON

string: Before herself, almost at fainting under
speaker: AEGEON

string: The pleasing punishment that women bear,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Had made provision for her following me
speaker: AEGEON

string: And soon and safe arrived where I was.
speaker: AEGEON

string: There had she not been long, but she became
speaker: AEGEON

string: A joyful mother of two goodly sons;
speaker: AEGEON

string: And, which was strange, the one so like the other,
speaker: AEGEON

string: As could not be distinguish'd but by names.
speaker: AEGEON

string: That very hour, and in the self-same inn,
speaker: AEGEON

string: A meaner woman was delivered
speaker: AEGEON

string: Of such a burden, male twins, both alike:
speaker: AEGEON

string: Those,--for their parents were exceeding poor,--
speaker: AEGEON

string: I bought and brought up to attend my sons.
speaker: AEGEON

string: My wife, not meanly proud of two such boys,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Made daily motions for our home return:
speaker: AEGEON

string: Unwilling I agreed. Alas! too soon,
speaker: AEGEON

string: We came aboard.
speaker: AEGEON

string: A league from Epidamnum had we sail'd,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Before the always wind-obeying deep
speaker: AEGEON

string: Gave any tragic instance of our harm:
speaker: AEGEON

string: But longer did we not retain much hope;
speaker: AEGEON

string: For what obscured light the heavens did grant
speaker: AEGEON

string: Did but convey unto our fearful minds
speaker: AEGEON

string: A doubtful warrant of immediate death;
speaker: AEGEON

string: Which though myself would gladly have embraced,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Yet the incessant weepings of my wife,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Weeping before for what she saw must come,
speaker: AEGEON

string: And piteous plainings of the pretty babes,
speaker: AEGEON

string: That mourn'd for fashion, ignorant what to fear,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Forced me to seek delays for them and me.
speaker: AEGEON

string: And this it was, for other means was none:
speaker: AEGEON

string: The sailors sought for safety by our boat,
speaker: AEGEON

string: And left the ship, then sinking-ripe, to us:
speaker: AEGEON

string: My wife, more careful for the latter-born,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Had fasten'd him unto a small spare mast,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Such as seafaring men provide for storms;
speaker: AEGEON

string: To him one of the other twins was bound,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Whilst I had been like heedful of the other:
speaker: AEGEON

string: The children thus disposed, my wife and I,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Fixing our eyes on whom our care was fix'd,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Fasten'd ourselves at either end the mast;
speaker: AEGEON

string: And floating straight, obedient to the stream,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Was carried towards Corinth, as we thought.
speaker: AEGEON

string: At length the sun, gazing upon the earth,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Dispersed those vapours that offended us;
speaker: AEGEON

string: And by the benefit of his wished light,
speaker: AEGEON

string: The seas wax'd calm, and we discovered
speaker: AEGEON

string: Two ships from far making amain to us,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Of Corinth that, of Epidaurus this:
speaker: AEGEON

string: But ere they came,--O, let me say no more!
speaker: AEGEON

string: Gather the sequel by that went before.
speaker: AEGEON

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Nay, forward, old man; do not break off so;
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: For we may pity, though not pardon thee.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: AEGEON
speaker: AEGEON

string: O, had the gods done so, I had not now
speaker: AEGEON

string: Worthily term'd them merciless to us!
speaker: AEGEON

string: For, ere the ships could meet by twice five leagues,
speaker: AEGEON

string: We were encounterd by a mighty rock;
speaker: AEGEON

string: Which being violently borne upon,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Our helpful ship was splitted in the midst;
speaker: AEGEON

string: So that, in this unjust divorce of us,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Fortune had left to both of us alike
speaker: AEGEON

string: What to delight in, what to sorrow for.
speaker: AEGEON

string: Her part, poor soul! seeming as burdened
speaker: AEGEON

string: With lesser weight but not with lesser woe,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Was carried with more speed before the wind;
speaker: AEGEON

string: And in our sight they three were taken up
speaker: AEGEON

string: By fishermen of Corinth, as we thought.
speaker: AEGEON

string: At length, another ship had seized on us;
speaker: AEGEON

string: And, knowing whom it was their hap to save,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Gave healthful welcome to their shipwreck'd guests;
speaker: AEGEON

string: And would have reft the fishers of their prey,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Had not their bark been very slow of sail;
speaker: AEGEON

string: And therefore homeward did they bend their course.
speaker: AEGEON

string: Thus have you heard me sever'd from my bliss;
speaker: AEGEON

string: That by misfortunes was my life prolong'd,
speaker: AEGEON

string: To tell sad stories of my own mishaps.
speaker: AEGEON

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: And for the sake of them thou sorrowest for,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Do me the favour to dilate at full
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: What hath befall'n of them and thee till now.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: AEGEON
speaker: AEGEON

string: My youngest boy, and yet my eldest care,
speaker: AEGEON

string: At eighteen years became inquisitive
speaker: AEGEON

string: After his brother: and importuned me
speaker: AEGEON

string: That his attendant--so his case was like,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Reft of his brother, but retain'd his name--
speaker: AEGEON

string: Might bear him company in the quest of him:
speaker: AEGEON

string: Whom whilst I labour'd of a love to see,
speaker: AEGEON

string: I hazarded the loss of whom I loved.
speaker: AEGEON

string: Five summers have I spent in furthest Greece,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Roaming clean through the bounds of Asia,
speaker: AEGEON

string: And, coasting homeward, came to Ephesus;
speaker: AEGEON

string: Hopeless to find, yet loath to leave unsought
speaker: AEGEON

string: Or that or any place that harbours men.
speaker: AEGEON

string: But here must end the story of my life;
speaker: AEGEON

string: And happy were I in my timely death,
speaker: AEGEON

string: Could all my travels warrant me they live.
speaker: AEGEON

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Hapless AEgeon, whom the fates have mark'd
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: To bear the extremity of dire mishap!
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Now, trust me, were it not against our laws,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Against my crown, my oath, my dignity,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Which princes, would they, may not disannul,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: My soul would sue as advocate for thee.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: But, though thou art adjudged to the death
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: And passed sentence may not be recall'd
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: But to our honour's great disparagement,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Yet I will favour thee in what I can.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Therefore, merchant, I'll limit thee this day
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: To seek thy life by beneficial help:
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Try all the friends thou hast in Ephesus;
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Beg thou, or borrow, to make up the sum,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: And live; if no, then thou art doom'd to die.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Gaoler, take him to thy custody.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Gaoler
speaker: Gaoler

string: I will, my lord.
speaker: Gaoler

string: AEGEON
speaker: AEGEON

string: Hopeless and helpless doth AEgeon wend,
speaker: AEGEON

string: But to procrastinate his lifeless end.
speaker: AEGEON

string: Exeunt

First Merchant
speaker: First Merchant

speaker: First Merchant

speaker: OF SYRACUSE

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: A trusty villain, sir, that very oft,

speaker: First Merchant

speaker: OF SYRACUSE

speaker: First Merchant

ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: First Merchant

string: OF SYRACUSE
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

SCENE I. The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

speaker: ADRIANA

string: ADRIANA

string: LUCIANA

string: ADRIANA
speaker: ADRIANA

string: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

string: If you did wed my sister for her wealth,
speaker: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

string: Let not my sister read it in your eye;
speaker: LUCIANA

string: Be not thy tongue thy own shame's orator;
speaker: LUCIANA

string: Look sweet, be fair, become disloyalty;
speaker: LUCIANA

string: Apparel vice like virtue's harbinger;
speaker: LUCIANA

string: Bear a fair presence, though your heart be tainted;
speaker: LUCIANA

string: Teach sin the carriage of a holy saint;
speaker: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

string: Alas, poor women! make us but believe,

speaker: LUCIANA

string: We in your motion turn and you may move us.

speaker: LUCIANA

speaker: LUCIANA

string: I, sir, am Dromio; command him away.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: I, sir, am Dromio; pray, let me stay.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: OF SYRACUSE
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: AEgeon art thou not? or else his ghost?
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: O, my old master! who hath bound him here?
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: AEMELIA
speaker: AEMELIA

string: Whoever bound him, I will loose his bonds
speaker: AEMELIA

string: And gain a husband by his liberty.
speaker: AEMELIA

string: Speak, old AEgeon, if thou be'st the man
speaker: AEMELIA

string: That hadst a wife once call'd AEmilia
speaker: AEMELIA

string: That bore thee at a burden two fair sons:
speaker: AEMELIA

string: O, if thou be'st the same AEgeon, speak,
speaker: AEMELIA

string: And speak unto the same AEmilia!
speaker: AEMELIA

string: AEGEON
speaker: AEGEON

string: If I dream not, thou art AEmilia:
speaker: AEGEON

string: If thou art she, tell me where is that son
speaker: AEGEON

string: That floated with thee on the fatal raft?
speaker: AEGEON

string: AEMELIA
speaker: AEMELIA

string: By men of Epidamnum he and I
speaker: AEMELIA

string: And the twin Dromio all were taken up;
speaker: AEMELIA

string: But by and by rude fishermen of Corinth
speaker: AEMELIA

string: By force took Dromio and my son from them
speaker: AEMELIA

string: And me they left with those of Epidamnum.
speaker: AEMELIA

string: What then became of them I cannot tell
speaker: AEMELIA

string: I to this fortune that you see me in.
speaker: AEMELIA

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Why, here begins his morning story right;
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: These two Antipholuses, these two so like,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: And these two Dromios, one in semblance,--
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Besides her urging of her wreck at sea,--
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: These are the parents to these children,
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Which accidentally are met together.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Antipholus, thou camest from Corinth first?
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: OF SYRACUSE
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: No, sir, not I; I came from Syracuse.
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Stay, stand apart; I know not which is which.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: OF EPHESUS
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: I came from Corinth, my most gracious lord,--
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: And I with him.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: OF EPHESUS
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: Brought to this town by that most famous warrior,
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: Duke Menaphon, your most renowned uncle.
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: ADRIANA
speaker: ADRIANA

string: Which of you two did dine with me to-day?
speaker: ADRIANA

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: ADRIANA

string: OF SYRACUSE
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: I, gentle mistress.
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: ADRIANA
speaker: ADRIANA

string: And are not you my husband?
speaker: ADRIANA

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: ADRIANA

string: OF EPHESUS
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: No; I say nay to that.
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: OF SYRACUSE
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: And so do I; yet did she call me so:
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: And this fair gentlewoman, her sister here,
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: Did call me brother.
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: To Luciana
What I told you then,
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: I hope I shall have leisure to make good;
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: If this be not a dream I see and hear.
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: ANGELO
speaker: ANGELO

string: That is the chain, sir, which you had of me.
speaker: ANGELO

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: ANGELO

string: OF SYRACUSE
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: I think it be, sir; I deny it not.
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: OF EPHESUS
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: And you, sir, for this chain arrested me.
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: ANGELO
speaker: ANGELO

string: I think I did, sir; I deny it not.
speaker: ANGELO

string: ADRIANA
speaker: ADRIANA

string: I sent you money, sir, to be your bail,
speaker: ADRIANA

string: By Dromio; but I think he brought it not.
speaker: ADRIANA

string: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: No, none by me.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: OF SYRACUSE
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: This purse of ducats I received from you,
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: And Dromio, my man, did bring them me.
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: I see we still did meet each other's man,
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: And I was ta'en for him, and he for me,
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: And thereupon these errors are arose.
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: OF EPHESUS
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: These ducats pawn I for my father here.
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: It shall not need; thy father hath his life.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Courtezan
speaker: Courtezan

string: Sir, I must have that diamond from you.
speaker: Courtezan

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: Courtezan

string: OF EPHESUS
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: There, take it; and much thanks for my good cheer.
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: AEMELIA
speaker: AEMELIA

string: Renowned duke, vouchsafe to take the pains
speaker: AEMELIA

string: To go with us into the abbey here
speaker: AEMELIA

string: And hear at large discoursed all our fortunes:
speaker: AEMELIA

string: And all that are assembled in this place,
speaker: AEMELIA

string: That by this sympathized one day's error
speaker: AEMELIA

string: Have suffer'd wrong, go keep us company,
speaker: AEMELIA

string: And we shall make full satisfaction.
speaker: AEMELIA

string: Thirty-three years have I but gone in travail
speaker: AEMELIA

string: Of you, my sons; and till this present hour
speaker: AEMELIA

string: My heavy burden ne'er delivered.
speaker: AEMELIA

string: The duke, my husband and my children both,
speaker: AEMELIA

string: And you the calendars of their nativity,
speaker: AEMELIA

string: Go to a gossips' feast and go with me;
speaker: AEMELIA

string: After so long grief, such festivity!
speaker: AEMELIA

string: DUKE SOLINUS
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: With all my heart, I'll gossip at this feast.
speaker: DUKE SOLINUS

string: Exeunt all but Antipholus of Syracuse, Antipholus of Ephesus, Dromio of Syracuse and Dromio of Ephesus
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: Master, shall I fetch your stuff from shipboard?
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: OF EPHESUS
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: Dromio, what stuff of mine hast thou embark'd?
speaker: OF EPHESUS

string: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: Your goods that lay at host, sir, in the Centaur.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: ANTIPHOLUS
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: OF SYRACUSE
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: He speaks to me. I am your master, Dromio:
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: Come, go with us; we'll look to that anon:
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: Embrace thy brother there; rejoice with him.
speaker: OF SYRACUSE

string: Exeunt Antipholus of Syracuse and Antipholus of Ephesus
DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: There is a fat friend at your master's house,
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: That kitchen'd me for you to-day at dinner:
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: She now shall be my sister, not my wife.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: Methinks you are my glass, and not my brother:
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: I see by you I am a sweet-faced youth.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: Will you walk in to see their gossiping?
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: Not I, sir; you are my elder.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: That's a question: how shall we try it?
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: We'll draw cuts for the senior: till then lead thou first.
speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

string: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: Nay, then, thus:
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: We came into the world like brother and brother;
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: And now let's go hand in hand, not one before another.
speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS

string: Exeunt
